channel.title: Salem Fields Video Podcast
channel.description: The SFCC video podcast features the weekly message presented at Salem Fields Community Church in Fredericksburg, VA. The vision of Salem Fields Community Church is simple: to know Jesus and to share Real Hope with anyone, everywhere.
channel.itunes:subtitle: The SFCC podcast features the weekly message presented at Salem Fields Community Church in Fredericksburg, VA.

item.title: Real Relationships : Elijah and Elisha
item.description: The question of who is investing in you and who are you investing in is really a command. Jesus was always investing in his followers and commanding them to do likewise. The story of Elijah and Elisha gives a really good example of how the REAL-RELATIONSHIP INVESTMENT works.

item.title: Real Relationships : A Purpose, Plan, and Place for you
item.description: #REAL-Relationship investment leads to life change. When someone invests in you and you invest in others lives change, purposes are discovered and we move into God’s plan and place for our lives. Who are you investing in and who’s investing in you?
item.itunes:subtitle: Real Relationships : A Purpose, Plan, and Place for you

item.title: Real Relationships : In and Out Investments
item.description: The question of who is investing in you and who are you investing in is not new. Jethro (Moses' father-in-law) invested in Moses and in turn he invested in Joshua. God, used their investments to rescue a people and bring forth a new nation. Your investment in others and others' investment in you can transform the world.

item.title: Real Relationships : Jesus' REAL Relationship Method
item.description: REAL Relationship seems impossible in our social media “friends” driven culture. Yet we were created to do life together through relationships. During his time on earth, Jesus modeled relationships well, and he makes REAL relationships possible. #GotRealRelationships?

item.title: Revelation: The Throne Part 2
item.description: The Throne is Revelation’s main location, The Lamb is Revelation’s main thing and Worship is Revelation’s main activity. Why? Because Jesus is worthy. There are lots of things that we can give our 24/7 adoration and worship. But only the Main Thing is Worthy.
item.itunes:subtitle: Revelation: The Throne Part 2

item.title: Revelation: The Throne Part 1
item.description: To understand the Book of Revelation and WHAT WILL BE, you need to Start at the Throne. The Throne is where the MAIN THING resides, it’s where the main thing is modeled, and it will be where the main thing in life will be rewarded and/or judged. Don’t miss this peer into the throne room of Revelation... for Salvation awaits you there.

item.title: Revelation - Start at Home: Laodicea
item.description: Have you ever ordered your food or beverage lukewarm? Most folks, except for Goldielocks of fairytale fame, would answer that question no. Most people like to consume their food and drinks hot or cold. Likewise, we are encouraged to possess a hot faith in Christ because lukewarm will not do. What’s your spiritual temperature?

item.title: Revelation - Start at Home: Philadelphia
item.description: Do you ever feel overwhelmed when doing all you can to live for God? God wants you to know that He knows your situation, He is still in charge. So you can find your strength in Him.

item.title: Revelation - Start at Home: Sardis
item.description: In this message we continue our "Revelation" Series by looking at the church of Sardis and discovering what Jesus says to a dying church...don't give up...wake up!
item.itunes:subtitle: Revelation - Start at Home: Sardis
item.itunes:summary: In this message we continue our "Revelation" Series by looking at the church of Sardis and discovering what Jesus says to a dying church...don't give up...wake up!

item.title: Revelation - Start at Home: Thyatira
item.description: We hear the word tolerant tossed around with great pride these days. The question is tolerant of what? The key to Christian tolerance is balancing tolerance with Truth. In doing so we remember our allegiance to Christ and love for others.
item.itunes:subtitle: Revelation - Start at Home: Thyatira

item.title: Revelation - Start At Home: Pergamum
item.description: Buying the lies of popular culture can trip you up and distract you from the MAIN THING. It’s important to know and live the truth of the Bible. The real truth will set you free. KNOW TRUTH?
item.itunes:subtitle: Revelation - Start At Home: Pergamum
item.itunes:summary: Buying the lies of popular culture can trip you up and distract you from the MAIN THING. It’s important to know and live the truth of the Bible. The real truth will set you free. KNOW TRUTH?

item.title: Revelation - Start At Home: Smyrna
item.description: This week’s message deal what how we respond under intense pressure and persecution. What happens when you are squeezed? How do you respond to the tough stuff in life? Jesus’ revelation/messages to the suffering church in Smyrna is a message for all of us. He is near to those hurting, no need for fear and don’t quit. Sounds like good advice to me.

item.title: Revelation - Start at Home: Ephesus
item.description: James begins the Revelation series proper with the theme Start At Home. We are encouraged to reach out at home, self-improve at home, so Jesus begins His reclaiming, recycling, renewing, reusing recreating, and renovating at home. What’s Home? —The Church in the middle of tough times, the Church that has lost it fervor; and a church seduced by false teachings. Jesus' message to the church in Ephesus... Rediscover your NUMERO UNO Love. What or who is your 1st Love?

item.title: Revelation Part 1
item.description: It’s been said that we live in an unfocused culture and that many of us who actually focus, only focus on our needs, wants and desires. So it makes sense that when someone read the book Revelation they read into it their worldview. So Revelation becomes whatever the reader want to to be. Focus in the key to understanding the prophecy of John the revelator. This week James will help you focus on the main thing of Revelation... and its not a number (666) not a beast, not a war, not destruction, but worship of the Lamb who was slain.

item.title: Crossfit - The Finale
item.description: We wrap up CROSSFIT looking at the top 4 lessons from growing as Belongers. Growth just doesn’t happen by accident it takes Prayer, Power, Persistence to get the Payoff.
item.itunes:subtitle: Crossfit - The Finale
item.itunes:summary: We wrap up CROSSFIT looking at the top 4 lessons from growing as Belongers. Growth just doesn’t happen by accident it takes Prayer, Power, Persistence to get the Payoff.

item.title: Crossfit - Exercise: Submission
item.description: We don’t like the “S” word. What’s the “S” word? SUBMISSION. We don’t submit to anyone. Our culture tells us submission is for losers. But in the spiritual realm the “S” word— submission is the key to winning. Submission is the last exercise in our Crossfit spiritual workout. Come discover how you win by loosing.

item.title: State Of The Church - Team Work Makes The Dream Work
item.description: In this message, we wrap up the State of the Church series with a look at how "Teamwork Makes the Dream Work." God has great things in store for you and SFCC, and it takes a team to make it happen.
item.itunes:subtitle: State Of The Church - Team Work Makes The Dream Work
item.itunes:summary: In this message, we wrap up the State of the Church series with a look at how "Teamwork Makes the Dream Work." God has great things in store for you and SFCC, and it takes a team to make it happen.

item.title: State Of The Church - Holy Shift
item.description: Regardless of your stage in life, there's one thing we can all agree on about this past year: Life has been disrupted. That also includes the Church-- SFCC and beyond. In this message, we will track a biblical story that aligns with how many of us are feeling; desiring things to return to "normal" but realizing we must also face the changes head-on. Perhaps for each of us, and for the big-C Church, it's time for a Holy Shift.

Perhaps for each of us, and for the big-C Church, it's time for a Holy Shift.

item.title: State Of The Church - R.A.W.
item.description: Have you ever been knocked down by life and found it hard to bounce back? Being knocked down is something that we all face at some time or another, but for some bouncing can feel like an impossible task. In this message, we talk about building resiliency learning to bounce back. We will learn how R.A.W. (Resiliency Among Warriors) has been created to provide our military community with the services need to be Resilient Warriors.
item.itunes:subtitle: State Of The Church - R.A.W.

item.title: State Of The Church - Let There Be Freedom
item.description: Jesus said, “If the Son sets you free, you are free indeed.” The worst kept secret in the world is that modern slavery exists, and it is capturing more and more innocents every day. Every year in the Philippines, an estimated 1 million men, women, and children are needed to meet the demand of the sex trade. 1 million of our brothers and sisters are enslaved in utter darkness. Find out how Jesus dealt with those he encountered that were enslaved by the sex industry and learn what we are called to and can do to help stop it.

item.title: State Of The Church - Engaging The Vision
item.description: The world is littered with mission and vision statements. However the difference between words spoken in sermon, written on paper and websites is strategy and engagement. As we move into new vision at SFCC we want to engage Belongers in fresh, and exciting ways. We believe that increased mission and vision engagement will not only change US the church, but also the culture and the globe.

item.title: State Of The Church
item.description: In this message, Pastor James shares God's vision for the future of SFCC. The vision is huge, audacious, and futuristic but so is God and so are we when we engage God's plan for our future. Don't miss the beginning of a new book in the history of SFCC and our mission to Belong as we know Jesus and share real hope with anyone, everywhere.

item.title: Crossfit - Working Out In The Word
item.description: In life workouts just don’t happen they take intentional planning and discipline and they do the body good. The same in true with WORD-workouts. Bible study—working out in the Word take intentional planning and discipline and they do both the body and soul good. But both are really tough until we get into a habit of working out. Our physical bodies will eventually give way to decay but our souls will live on for ever. How’s you “Workout in the Word” going?

item.title: Crossfit - Prayer Exercise
item.description: Prayer is not for the faint of heart. It takes real faith and discipline to engage in prayer. Prayer is not a give-me wishlist exercise but rather an exercise of heavy lifting. But the good news or God-news is this, ”Our prayers may be awkward. Our attempts may be feeble. But since the power of prayer is in the one who hears it and not in the one who says it, our prayers do make a difference." -Max Lucado

item.title: Crossfit - Exercise of Solitude
item.description: This week's spiritual discipline is the exercise of solitude. Theologian Dietrich Bonheoffer once wrote, “We are so afraid of the silence that we chase ourselves from one event to the next in order not to have to spend a moment alone with ourselves, in order not to have to look at ourselves in the mirror.” Maybe you can relate. But did you know that silence and solitude were a regular pattern of life for Jesus? Jesus found time for silence and solitude – even in the busyness of His life.

item.title: Crossfit - Rescued For A Crossfit Life
item.description: Easter was God’s Rescue Plan executed for us once and for all. Everything about EASTER points to transformed CROSSFIT living. Until the cross is more than jewelry, home decor and symbolic iconography we will never understand its transforming power. The cross changed everything for a group of first-century Belongers. It can do the same for you. Does the Crossfit in your life?

item.title: Crossfit - We All Need A Plan Of Rescue
item.description: Have you ever been in a situation where you needed to be rescued? That was us—all of humanity was in a bind of our own making without hope of rescue. The Good News of Passion Week is that God had a plan. And not just any plan. But a plan of rescue for all time and eternity. When Jesus rode in to Jerusalem for the last time you and I were on his mind and so was THE PLAN. Come discover the genesis of God’s Amazing Rescue Plan.

item.title: Crossfit - P90X 4 The Soul
item.description: Today's spiritual discipline is the exercise of Confession. Confession is so misunderstood in the protestant evangelical modern church. We think of it as something that harkens back to our catholic roots. Something that is in the pass or not necessary due to Grace. But we couldn’t be further from the truth. CONFESSION IS THE P90X OF THE SOUL.

item.title: Crossfit - It's All In The Heart
item.description: This weeks exercise is worship. Is your worship just going through the motions or do you have an authentic connection—a “walk in to cool of the day” relationship? It’s not about your desired music style. In fact it’s not about you or music. Worship is a 24/7 heart relationship with The Spiritual Trainer- Jesus.

item.title: Crossfit - Chewing On The Word Of God
item.description: We begin our exercises this week. Our first Crossfit exercise is meditation. Meditation is chewing on the Word of God so it gets inside of us and transforms our thinking, walk, talk and actions. The old adage is true: "you are what you eat." Are your CrossFit?

item.title: Crossfit - Removing Growth Barriers
item.description: Spiritual Fitness is all about growth. God’s will is for Belongers to grow up and become just like Jesus. In most cases we have barriers to growth in our lives. Lack of growth happen when barriers to knowledge, motivation, accountability, nourishment, and commitment spring up in our lives. God can help remove growth barriers in your life so you can be CrossFit.

item.title: Crossfit - Spiritual Fitness 101
item.description: Physical trainers tell us that physical fitness begins with assessment. Spiritual fitness is no different. Before we can know where we are headed, we must evaluate our present situation. How is your spiritual fitness going? Where do you see the need for growth, and what is your plan to get there? When Paul encouraged his protege Timothy toward eternal fitness, he said: “workouts in the gymnasium are useful, but a disciplined life in God is far more so, making you fit both today and forever.” I Tim. 4:8 (MSG). Spiritual Fitness begins when we are CrossFit. How do we become CrossFit? I’m glad you asked!

item.title: Sweet Tarts - Stale Candy
item.description: Why is it that there always seems to be that one chocolate in a box of chocolates that you expect to taste amazing, but it ends up tasting stale or doesn’t meet your expectations? Love and relationships are similar. We have an expectation of what love and our relationships should be like, but we find them falling short on the taste test. In the the final message in our two-part “Sweet Tarts” series on relationships, we explore how our views of what love is or isn’t forms how we interact within our relationships, and how we can ensure that the love we give and receive will be authentic and stay sweet.

item.title: Sweet Tarts - The Inevitable Tart
item.description: Sweet Tarts. Next to chocolate, they’re one of the most famous Valentine candies. You may love ‘em for their sweetness or hate 'em for their tart. Our relationships with others can be like that—one moment sweet, the next moment tart. But what does love look like, especially when you're navigating tartness?

item.title: Emerged - New Year Reaching
item.description: An Emerged New Year of Reaching is totally possible. The problem is that we feel like we must be experts to reach others. We say things like: "I’m not an evangelist, Bible scholar, pastor or counselor." That’s great because Jesus’ plan is about regular people reaching other people. Are you REACHING?

We say things like: "I’m not an evangelist, Bible scholar, pastor or counselor." That’s great because Jesus’ plan is about regular people reaching other people. Are you REACHING?

item.title: Emerged - New Year Growing
item.description: Have you ever wanted to be a kid forever? Well there’s a place for child-like faith, but as Belongers in the Kingdom it’s God’s will that we GROW up: in humility, discipline, love, and unity. He wants us to recognize the beauty in our diversity and begins to move and groove together as one. Emerged New year growing is Growing Up God’s way.

item.title: Emerged - New Year Serving
item.description: What are people always saying about you? Do they say "he laughs all the time," "she’s funny," or "he talks too much?" What if they said, "he/she is always serving?" In this message, discover what it means to live an EMERGED NEW YEAR life of service.

item.title: Emerged - New Year of Giving
item.description: Balance is important in life. Balance in our spiritual, physical, and emotional lives is of utmost importance. But balance is also important in our giving and finances. Because finances follow the law of the Harvest and not the law of Pinocchio.
item.itunes:subtitle: Emerged - New Year of Giving

item.title: Emerged - One Life To Live
item.description: It’s a new year with new opportunities to embrace EMERGED New Year Living. How do you leave 2020 behind and move triumphantly into 2021? The Apostle Paul tell us to: 1) be very wise, 2) make the most of the time we are given, 3) live with purpose, and 4) know what God wants. With these four actions you will experience Emerged New Year Living. Beware, it’s harder than it sounds.

item.title: Emerged - New Year Hope
item.description: A new year is coming and most of us are glad to be saying goodbye to 2020. But, what are your goals in 2021 and what will you accomplish? Answer this question… Next Year, I want to do ______________? Do you have a plan of action? The Story of Nehemiah is the story of a man with a plan who EMERGED with Hope. Discover the plan of Hope God has for you in 2021.

item.title: Welcome To The Neighborhood - What Now?
item.description: Even though it's dark outside, Christmas is coming. We've hung our lights, sent our cards, and are hopeful that the Light is on his way. But the story of Christmas doesn’t end at the manger-- because Jesus sure doesn’t. And neither do you. In this message, we discover how God has strategically sent you to share his Light. Welcome to the neighborhood!

item.title: Welcome To The Neighborhood - The Who
item.description: There is a certain amount of excitement and anticipation in the air when you see a new neighbor moving in. You start to wonder why they moved in, where they came from, and what type of neighbor they are going to be. I can imagine there was a similar excitement and anticipation in the air with the announcement of the arrival of Jesus the Messiah coming to the neighborhood. The difference between Jesus moving in and just some other person is that Jesus is moving into the neighborhood for a who. In this message, we continue our series “Welcome to the Neighborhood” as we learn just who the who is.

item.title: Welcome To The Neighborhood - Why Now?
item.description: Darkness is pervasive in our world and even in our lives. The result of living in a fallen world is that darkness by way of storms, disease, death, and consequences from bad choices catch up with us. The good news is God is always pursuing us and at just the right time the WORD became flesh and blood and Moved into the Neighborhood--turning on the light. John the Apostle says, The Life-Light blazed out of the darkness; the darkness couldn't put it out. The Light has come to our darkness, but will we embrace the LIGHT. In this message, we rediscover the long-awaited for Light. Welcome to the neighborhood!

item.title: Welcome To The Neighborhood - A Branch Springs Up In The Hood
item.description: God’s great move into the neighborhood is set during the darkest of days for his people. Every great rescue story has a dark time—a time when it seems that hope is lost, evil reigns supreme and the enemies can not and will not relent. But in the middle of neighborhood darkness a green shoot sprout up from the chopped down stump of Jesse. A shoot that will bring light. The story of Christmas begins with a shoot in darkness… light is coming. Welcome to the neighborhood.

item.title: Thanksgiving 2020
item.description: This week our nation celebrates Thanksgiving. One way that we celebrate Thanksgiving at SFCC is through our participation in the Thanksgiving Offering. This special time of giving enables us as a church to achieve our mission of taking Hope to anyone everywhere while also helping us meet our World Evangelism Fund responsibilities. Our special speaker is Larry Bollinger missionary to the Philippines. Come help us change the world through the Hope that Jesus gives. Will you PRAY, GIVE & GO!

This special time of giving enables us as a church to achieve our mission of taking Hope to anyone everywhere while also helping us meet our World Evangelism Fund responsibilities. Our special speaker is Larry Bollinger missionary to the Philippines. Come help us change the world through the Hope that Jesus gives. Will you PRAY, GIVE & GO!

item.title: A Belonger's Thanksgiving
item.description: True Belongers are called to give thanks. In fact the Bible says Thank God NO matter what. Despite COVID19, changed school and works schedules, layoffs, and election results we are called to give thanks. There are two types of people: the grateful and the ungrateful. Which one are you? In this message, discover the secrets of an attitude of gratitude.
item.itunes:subtitle: A Belonger's Thanksgiving

Despite COVID19, changed school and works schedules, layoffs, and election results we are called to give thanks. There are two types of people: the grateful and the ungrateful. Which one are you? In this message, discover the secrets of an attitude of gratitude.

item.title: Watch The Lamb
item.description: The election is over... maybe. What do you do as Belongers in a divided society when a bitter election comes slowly to the end and no matter which side you are on you feel empty? The problem is that as Belongers our first allegiance is not to an elephant or a donkey but to the Lamb. In this message, Pastor James helps us to discover that our greatest freedom is not secured by a political party or ideology. We are not called to bow before an elephant or a donkey but before the Lamb of God who has taken away the sin of the world and who will reign on the throne of God forever.

item.title: Blueprints For A Belonging Community - Extreme Makeover: Home Edition
item.description: Foundations are important. How important? In our concluding Blueprints message, Jesus said that good foundations are the difference between a life that stands when the storms of life rage and one that completely collapses. In this message, we will discover how to work the Blueprints for a Belonging Community—Jesus’ Kingdom ethic into the foundation of your life. Why? Because the storms they are coming to a foundation near you.

item.title: Blueprints For A Belonging Community - Slackers Need Not Apply
item.description: There are two types of people in life slackers and scrutinizer. One person examines life and does the vigorous work of discovering the right way, listening to the right voices and building on the right foundation. The other persons plays life by ear—a no shoes, no shirt, no problem I did it my way life. In the end one life thrives in the storms while the other fall like a house of cards. Which person does your inside-life represent a slacker or a scrutinizer? Choose wisely, because the storms… they-are-a-coming

item.title: Blueprints For A Belonging Community - The Golden Rule Redux
item.description: As Belongers, we waste time trying to manage and control others by blaming, condemning and forcing our way on them. This kind of behavior just boomerang back on us. Instead, Jesus says Belongers should create a community of agape love by learning to ask of other and God. Do You BELONG

item.title: Blueprints For A Belonging Community - Relax, God's Got It
item.description: God’s Got It. We’ve heard that before. But what about the real stuff—the meat and potatoes stuff of life? Does he have my needs for food, shelter, safety and my occasional wants? Jesus in this discourse of Blueprints for a Belonging Community, encourages us to put worry aside and trust the God who knows us best and loves us most. In this message, Pastor James shares Jesus’ plan of trust and contentment for life.

In this message, Pastor James shares Jesus’ plan of trust and contentment for life.

item.title: Blueprints For A Belonging Community - It's Not About You
item.description: “IT’S NOT ABOUT YOU” we’ve heard that phrase so much these days that it’s almost become cliché. Yet our culture says everything is about us—our needs, our wants, our likes, our dislikes etc. All the worship, doctrine, political, and social issues wars that have divided our culture and the church have been about a mentality that is the opposite of the phrase IT’S NOT ABOUT YOU. If any phase sums up Jesus’ Blueprints for a Belonging Community it is this IT’S NOT ABOUT YOU.
item.itunes:subtitle: Blueprints For A Belonging Community - It's Not About You

item.title: Blueprints For A Belonging Community - Faux People, Promise, and Prophets
item.description: Living out the Blueprints for a Belonging Community means that our inside life is more important than the life we show on the outside. Jesus’ morality for Belongers focuses on a right heart and mind that transforms our outside living.
item.itunes:subtitle: Blueprints For A Belonging Community - Faux People, Promise, and Prophets
item.itunes:summary: Living out the Blueprints for a Belonging Community means that our inside life is more important than the life we show on the outside. Jesus’ morality for Belongers focuses on a right heart and mind that transforms our outside living.

item.title: Blueprints For A Belonging Community - Pass The Salt - Going Public
item.description: The Blueprints to a Belonging Community— The Sermon on the Mount are a call to be Salt and Light and messengers of the Kingdom. Salt adds flavor, preserves and purifies, while light dispels darkness. We are called to do the same in a world that desperately needs God’s salt and light. This week we will discover our role in God’s Belonging community marketing strategy.
item.itunes:subtitle: Blueprints For A Belonging Community - Pass The Salt - Going Public

item.title: Blueprints For A Belonging Community - Messed Up = Blessed Up
item.description: The Preamble to the Blueprints of a Belonging Community— what we call the Beatitudes is the Magna Carta for messed up people. What else would we expect from Jesus? Simply put, they are hope for hopeless messed up people. In order for us to wrap our minds around this new revolutionary view of the Beatitudes we’ve got to re-examine Jesus’ radical words to his followers then and now. If you’re messed up you are also blessed-up.

item.title: Blueprints For A Belonging Community - A Call To Revolutionary Belonging
item.description: Jesus' Blueprints for a Belonging Community—his Message on the Mount is the ultimate word concerning belonging in community—God’s Kingdom. His blueprints for belonging are as radical and revolutionary today as they were in the first century. When we truly live out his blueprints for belonging, we quit doing church, we get rid of the status quo religion, and we turn the world right-side-up by going public with Jesus.

item.title: Belong - The Barriers to Belonging
item.description: The wrap-up message for BELONG helps us recognize and do away with the barriers to true belonging. We do not belong to ourselves but to God, and through him, to his people. At long last, our search for true belonging can have a happy ending. In Christ and among his people, we’re fully known and fully loved.

item.title: Belong - The R&R Of Belonging Part 2
item.description: Active belonging comes with responsibilities and rights. Your rights as BELONG’ERS are all about your leaders/pastors/teachers being like Jesus. You have the Right to Leaders who Feed, Lead, Model, and Plead Like Jesus. Do You Belong?

item.description: Active Belonging comes with its own R&R (rights and responsibilities). Belonging in any organization, family, institution, or job has rights and responsibilities. When we actively participate in the Body of Christ we belong. Do you belong?

item.title: Family Reunion - Joseph
item.description: Joseph, known as the husband of Mary and the Earthly Father of Jesus, is a giant example of those willing to Faithfully serve behind the scenes. Joseph is a Giant of our Faith who obeyed God and served a vital role in the life of Jesus. Praise God for people like Joseph who desire the smile of God more than the applause of men.
item.itunes:subtitle: Family Reunion - Joseph
item.itunes:summary: Joseph, known as the husband of Mary and the Earthly Father of Jesus, is a giant example of those willing to Faithfully serve behind the scenes. Joseph is a Giant of our Faith who obeyed God and served a vital role in the life of Jesus. Praise God for people like Joseph who desire the smile of God more than the applause of men.

item.title: Family Reunion - Solomon
item.description: What is Wisdom? Solomon is known as the wisest man who ever lived. What does that mean? Of course, true wisdom only comes from understanding and knowing the Plan of God. Allowing God to lead our lives is the only path to true wisdom for each of us personally and for us as a Church.
item.itunes:subtitle: Family Reunion - Solomon
item.itunes:summary: What is Wisdom? Solomon is known as the wisest man who ever lived. What does that mean? Of course, true wisdom only comes from understanding and knowing the Plan of God. Allowing God to lead our lives is the only path to true wisdom for each of us personally and for us as a Church.

item.title: Family Reunion - Ruth
item.description: Because of tragic circumstances, Ruth's entire life changes and she is suddenly thrust into a brand new world. Her only family support is her Mother-in-law, but their connection is one of great love and devotion. As she bravely makes her decision to move forward, her statement of commitment resounds deeply in our hearts: Where you go I will go, and where you stay I will stay. Your people will be my people and your God my God. (Ruth 1:16) That was Ruth's statement to her Mother-in-law. Is your statement of commitment to God as strong?

item.title: Family Reunion - Rahab
item.description: Your family tree is full of stories and legacies. Some good and some not so good. But in a moment, the story can change and leave a legacy that reverberates through the generations. Our series “Family Reunion” continues in this message as we look at the story of Rahab and how a lifetime of unfaithfulness was transformed in an instant, leaving behind a legacy of faith and a lineage that includes Jesus.

item.title: Family Reunion - Judah
item.description: Summer is a time many of us meet up with family. But let's face it; we all have people in our families we wonder how can be related to us. However, while we often wish we could prune certain members from our family trees, Jesus shows us that when it comes to crazy family members, God doesn’t write them off. In fact, He writes them IN. In this message, we look at the creepy story of a surprising character in Jesus' family tree and how God may want to begin redeeming your own family-- through you.
item.itunes:subtitle: Family Reunion - Judah

item.title: Family Reunion - Abraham
item.description: Family reunions! Love 'em or hate 'em, you can't escape em. Sometimes you might wonder why no one chopped down your family tree. We all have that friend with a perfect family - like the grandfather that invented sliced bread and single handedly won the second world War. Take, for instance, Jesus. Perfect family tree, right? Wrong! If you want to see just how tangled the branches of the Messiah family tree is, watch this message.

item.title: Belong
item.description: You and I were created by God to belong. But, so often we settle for the substitutes of alienation, fitting in, and participation. Active belonging fosters passionate buy-in, deep connection, and caring that is contagion and unifying. Do you belong?

item.title: Lord Of All - Lord Of All I Have
item.description: Matthew, Chapters 5 - 7, is where we find Jesus' 'Sermon on The Mount.' In 6:21, Jesus says, 'Where your Treasure is, there will your Heart be also.' What is your treasure? Where is it today? Is that a good place for it? I hope you will think about these questions and be ready to hear more as you listen to this message.

item.title: Lord Of All - You've Got Talent
item.description: Believe it or not, YOU have Talents, Gifts, and Abilities that God given you to be used in the Work of His Kingdom. Do you know what your special gifts are? Are you working on this and through them to grow and be more of a blessing to those around you? In this message, we continue our series, 'Lord of ALL.' This week, 'Is Jesus Lord of All your TALENTS?' When He is, you will be thrilled with what He does with you and your life. He takes the Temporary and uses it for the Eternal. I sure look forward to being with you and your loved ones this weekend to talk about and ask God to Speak to our hearts! God is Moving and He LOVES YOU!

item.title: Lord Of All - Whose Time Is It?
item.description: No matter what we are doing, time flies by us. It is amazing how quickly the phases of life are lived. That's why Psalm 90 asks God to 'Teach us to number our days' So that we may live wisely. Since true wisdom comes from God we need to spend our time close to Him. If God is truly Lord of your life, He will have control of your time.

item.title: Everything's Changed - Part Seven
item.description: In this day of turmoil, fear, disease, isolation, and division -- are you living with the Peace and Joy of God's Holy Spirit in your heart? Lots of people have heard about Jesus and others even know His Story. Still, many of those have not experienced the Joy of His Forgiveness of their sins and The Power of His Holy Spirit in their lives. How about YOU? Acts 2 - They were Together - Suddenly The Holy Spirit FILLED them - They Changed their World! I want in on that!

item.title: Everything's Changed - Part Six
item.description: When Jesus was ready to leave His earthly ministry and ascend into Heaven, He simply told His Disciples to wait until they receive the power of His Holy Spirit. "Wait" is a hard word for us humans - especially in this day of instant gratification. How long? What do we do? What will happen? God knows we feel these ways but He expects us to trust Him, even when we are waiting on His answers. How's your trust level today? Remember Trust and Faith are very close to being synonymous.

item.title: Everything's Changed - Part Five
item.description: Sadly, a quick glance at Facebook or other social media platforms indicates that we live in a world of broken promises. We feel let down by politicians and relationships. Broken promises everywhere we look. How then can we possibly trust promises made over 2000 years ago? Join us in this episode and find out how God’s promises can not only be believed but will also be life changing.

item.title: Everything's Changed - Part Four
item.description: Forgiveness holds power unlike anything else. It’s transforming, freeing, and redemptive. Join us in this episode as we get a front row seat to the apostle Peter experiencing it first hand and we’ll learn how we too can be changed by the power of forgiveness. Our series “Everything’s Changed” continues and you don’t want to miss it!

item.title: Everything's Changed - Part Three
item.description: 2000 years ago, after Jesus' crucifixion, the Disciples would have been shouting, 'Everything's Changed!' Of course, we believe Jesus rose from the dead, but we still often shout, 'Everything's Changed!' The Disciples were scared & frustrated, so they went back to what they normally did - fishing. Jesus showed up and 'Everything Changed!' Join us in this episode as we look at this beautiful picture of Jesus' 3rd appearance to His Disciples after He rose from the grave!
item.itunes:subtitle: Everything's Changed - Part Three

Jesus showed up and 'Everything Changed!' Join us in this episode as we look at this beautiful picture of Jesus' 3rd appearance to His Disciples after He rose from the grave!

item.title: Everything's Changed - Part Two
item.description: Everything’s changed as we have known it over the past month. When we experience change it can bring with it all kinds of thoughts and feelings. A couple of feelings we tend to deal with are doubt and uncertainty. Could it be possible when we feel uncertain or doubtful during times of change, that Jesus could be trying to speak to us? Join us in this episode and discover what Jesus wants us to learn during times when everything has changed.

Join us in this episode and discover what Jesus wants us to learn during times when everything has changed.

item.title: Everything's Changed - Part One
item.description: “Everything’s changed.” Wouldn’t you agree? With so many recent changes in our lives come so many concerns, and it’s enough to make your head spin. But did you know that Jesus’ disciples faced similar uncertainty and anxiety after the resurrection of Jesus? At first, none of them really understood that Jesus had risen from the dead. But by the end of 40 days, Jesus visited each of them, changed their minds, and initiated another change they did not expect— a change in THEM. In the midst of a crazy time in history, these initially scared and disappointed men and women were transformed into courageous people who went on to bear the good news of Jesus around the world. Join us in this episode for the first installment of our new 7-week message series “Everything’s Changed” with a look at how an unexpected detour becomes the very road where God shows up. And be sure to bring a pen and paper to draw along.

We're going to have a great time of worship led by our worship band and leaders. I plan to start a 3-week sermon series entitled, 'Pyramid of Faith.'
This Week: Is there a God? Palm Sunday: What does God look like? Easter: What does God want?
I'm praying for you and this great church. Let's all pray and listen as we seek God's Will and Blessing. He really loves you and so do I.

item.title: So Long
item.description: Even though plans for this weekend's service and celebration of Buddy and Gaye have been changed due to the COVID-19 outbreak, we will still worship together online with music and Buddy and Gaye will deliver their final message to SFCC. We will also share in communion together towards the end of the service and close out with a short thank you to Buddy and Gaye.

item.title: Finishing The Puzzle - Anthony Poindexter
item.description: You have the potential of being everything God has called you to be, however, you have one thing that’s holding you back. It's a piece of the puzzle that God is trying to use to finish a great puzzle that is your life. Join us in this episode to find the missing pieces of the puzzle.

item.description: Trusting God no matter what is something he wants us to do throughout our whole life. It's often a lot easier said than done though. Join us in this episode as we look at the story of Moses, learning how he trusted God no matter what and so can we.

item.title: Parting Words - What Matters To God
item.description: When Jesus left His disciples and ascended to Heaven to prepare a place for all who trust in Him, He left them with some parting words. He wanted them to remember and carry forward what was most important. In this series, Buddy & Gaye are sharing their Parting Words as they close their 25 year ministry at SFCC.

item.title: Parting Words - God Loves Nobodies
item.description: Parting words can be emotional, encouraging, compelling and challenging. During this series, Buddy and Gaye would like to relay to you some parting words as their final day approaches here at SFCC. We hope it will inspire and encourage you to be your best for God long after our departure.

item.title: Trophies And Swords - Pastor Rich Green
item.description: There are defining moments in life that shape us and make us who we are. Moments that increase our understanding of life and help us to learn what we're made of. But if we aren't careful we can start to deceive ourselves into thinking that what we did yesterday will sustain our todays and tomorrows, especially when it comes to our faith. Join us in this episode as we seek to make sure that the trophies we are collecting in life are bigger than anything this world has to offer and that our faith goes beyond the giants we slayed yesterday.
item.itunes:subtitle: Trophies And Swords - Pastor Rich Green

Join us in this episode as we seek to make sure that the trophies we are collecting in life are bigger than anything this world has to offer and that our faith goes beyond the giants we slayed yesterday.

item.title: Release Your Roar
item.description: Your voice, is your ROAR. We recently celebrated Martin Luther King, Jr., a gentle giant who had a big roar. His great cause, his personal risk, his ROAR made history and will impact humanity well into future generations. Everyone, no less, has a purpose and a voice that God wants to use for good. Yet too often fear and the storms of life paralyze us from risking new opportunities. It takes a leap of faith.

Yet too often fear and the storms of life paralyze us from risking new opportunities. It takes a leap of faith.

item.title: Hindsight - Pastor Jason Mueller
item.description: They say that hindsight is 20/20, and that can be a good thing. But focusing too much on what's behind us can cause us to miss out on what's ahead. Let's finally put the guilt and shame of the past behind us, so we can clearly see the 20/20 vision God has for us.

item.title: What Kind of Person Do You Want To Be in 2020
item.description: It's 2020 and the first month of a new decade. Please take a moment to reflect on our scripture text for this episode and ask yourself "what kind of person do I want to become in 2020?" “So be careful how you live. Don’t live like fools, but like those who are wise. Make the most of every opportunity in these evil days. Don’t act thoughtlessly, but understand what the Lord wants you to do.” Ephesians 5:15-17 (NLT)

item.title: Pass The Salt, Please - Susie Shellenberger Revival 2019
item.description: Join us for our fall Revival with Susie Shellenberger. Fasten your seatbelts! Once Susie begins, she delivers a rapid-pace, in-depth, non-compromising message that an audience will remember for years. Using lots of humor, she dives inside the Scripture and pulls out fresh, creative, captivating challenges. Susie is passionate about Jesus Christ and travels approximately 42 weeks/weekends every year guiding people into deeper intimacy with Him.

item.title: Waitin' On The Date
item.description: A birth is exciting, and that date is celebrated for a lifetime. A death date, humbles, concerns, even hurts. According to statistics, one out of one of us dies. Nobody chooses a birthdate, and we have little or no control over the date we die. But we do have control over what happens in between those two dates. Join us in this episode as we talk about making an impact in our world as we live "waitin' for the date" until our death.

Join us in this episode as we talk about making an impact in our world as we live "waitin' for the date" until our death.

item.title: Biggest Buts in the Bible - A Renewed Mind
item.description: Nothing is more powerful than a changed mind! How we think determines the direction our life will take. The Bible backs that thought up. In this episode we will finish up our series, Biggest BUTs in the Bible by exploring how to use the power of our thinking to build a healthy, godly life.

item.title: The Biggest Buts in the Bible: Fear is Real, But...
item.description: We're all afraid of something - spiders, mice, clowns, commitment, the dark, the unknown. The range goes far and wide of those things that can have a tight grip on our lives and ultimately paralyze us relationally and spiritually. While fear is powerful, nothing is greater than God's power in overcoming fear. Join us as we continue our series, The Biggest BUTs in the Bible, with "Fear is Real, BUT.........."

item.itunes:summary: We're all afraid of something - spiders, mice, clowns, commitment, the dark, the unknown. The range goes far and wide of those things that can have a tight grip on our lives and ultimately paralyze us relationally and spiritually. While fear is powerful, nothing is greater than God's power in overcoming fear. Join us as we continue our series, The Biggest BUTs in the Bible, with "Fear is Real, BUT.........."

item.title: The Biggest Buts in the Bible: Trouble But Peace
item.description: One thing you can be sure of in this life - we are all going to face trouble in this world. Join us as we look at how one Big But can change everything.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Biggest Buts in the Bible: Trouble But Peace
item.itunes:summary: One thing you can be sure of in this life - we are all going to face trouble in this world. Join us as we look at how one Big But can change everything.

item.title: Healing of the Paralytic - Len Sweet
item.description: In this episode, we will be joined by renowned author and speaker, Len Sweet. Len is one of the most sought-after speakers in the religious community around the world today. Author of 60 books, hundreds of articles, published sermons and homiletics resource preachthestory.com, his podcast, "Napkin Scribbles" can be accessed at leonardsweet.com or Spotify. Len appears on the "50 Most Influential World Christians in America" listing. Len works with graduate students at four institutions and currently holds the Charles Wesley Senior Professorship of Doctoral Studies at Tabor College and Evangelical Seminary.

item.title: Biggest Buts in the Bible
item.description: The Bible is filled with Big But moments in the life of God’s people. Join us as we start our new series “The Biggest Buts in The Bible.” This week we will look at a Big But teachable moment between Jesus and his disciples when it comes to telling the truth and keeping our word.

item.title: Bone Hampton
item.description: In this podcast we are excited to present the hilarious comedian, Bone Hampton. Bone is a master at making audiences feel like family. His clean, homespun humor, sharp wit, and easy delivery makes the Dove Award-winning “Comedian of the Year” one of the most highly sought after performers in the business.

item.title: Better Together
item.description: Whether you're single or married, in your 20's, 40's or 70's, constantly surrounded by people, or work alone, chances are that you know what it's like to feel lonely. Loneliness affects 2 out of 5 people at any given time and is said to be one of the epidemics facing our society. But it doesn't have to be. In this message we discover God's solution to loneliness and practical ways to become better together.

item.title: Growing Up Together
item.description: God desires us to grow spiritually but often times we think that's a solo endeavor when in reality, we were mean't to grow together. In this message we explore the importance of community in helping us grow into the people God desires us to become.

item.title: Engage - Logan Cannon
item.description: Sometimes, life doesn't go as we plan. And sometimes, disaster strikes and we are left to pick up the broken pieces. In this message, we will hear from special guest speaker, Logan Cannon, who has faced some of the darkest times imaginable but has chosen to shine his light through it all!

item.title: Neighboring - Can I Borrow A Cup Of Sugar
item.description: Sometimes in our hectic lives, we can easily miss treasures that are all around us, even as close as right next door. In our series, "Neighboring", we'll look at how those neighbors on your street, cul-de-sac, or even right next door might be one of those overlooked treasures.

item.title: Neighboring - Who Are Our Neighbors
item.description: Many of us are familiar with Mr. Roger's Neighborhood and how Mr. Rogers would come in singing, "It's a beautiful day in the neighborhood, a beautiful day for a neighbor. Would you be mine?" The song is so inviting as he was asking for everyone to be his neighbor. You and I live in a world where most people don't want to be a neighbor or we don't realize what a neighbor is. Join us as we take another look into neighboring and discovering who our neighbors are.

item.title: Neighboring - What & How
item.description: If the church was created to transform the world, why isn't today’s church having that kind of impact? Join us as we begin a new series, “NEIGHBORING” as we look at why SFCC exists, and how we can transform our world one neighbor and one neighborhood at a time.

item.title: Gone Fishin' - Rest
item.description: Have you ever needed a vacation after your vacation? Sometimes the things we do for rest really don't refresh, recharge and rejuvenate our body, mind and spirit. In this message, we close our series GONE FISHIN' by hooking into God's design for REST. The big catch: rest is more about RE-creation than recreation.

item.title: Gone Fishin' - Going Deeper
item.description: Salem Fields Community Church has GONE FISHIN'. You may never have thought of this before, but the way people fish, parallels with how we live our spiritual lives.
item.itunes:subtitle: Gone Fishin' - Going Deeper
item.itunes:summary: Salem Fields Community Church has GONE FISHIN'. You may never have thought of this before, but the way people fish, parallels with how we live our spiritual lives.

item.title: Gone Fishin' - Perspective
item.description: When the fish aren’t biting, fishing can turn into a lot of thinking. That’s the beautiful thing about fishing though, or even taking a step back in general - it gives you time to get some perspective that gets lost in our day to day life. Join in as we evaluate our outlook and seek to insure we have the right perspective in every facet of our lives.

item.title: Gone Fishin' - Expect the Unexpected
item.description: Join us for a new series, “Gone Fishin'!" We all face times in life when we want to unhook from the the rat-race and daily grind - maybe like when someone has "gone fishin'". This week we'll see how an unexpected meeting with Jesus can do just that by changing your life and circumstances forever.

item.title: G.O.A.T The Greatest of All Time: Jesus
item.description: When it comes to naming a G.O.A.T (Greatest Of All Time), it seems everyone has a differing opinion. People tend to choose based on personal values & preference. But could it be possible that Jesus is the ACTUAL G.O.A.T? Some say "yes", some, "no", and others, "maybe". What do you say? Why? Join in as the series, G.O.A.T concludes.
item.itunes:subtitle: G.O.A.T The Greatest of All Time: Jesus
item.itunes:summary: When it comes to naming a G.O.A.T (Greatest Of All Time), it seems everyone has a differing opinion. People tend to choose based on personal values & preference. But could it be possible that Jesus is the ACTUAL G.O.A.T? Some say "yes", some, "no", and others, "maybe". What do you say? Why? Join in as the series, G.O.A.T concludes.

item.title: G.O.A.T The Greatest of All Time: John
item.description: This G.O.A.T. of the Bible was a fisherman, an author, a leader, and one of Jesus' closest disciples. But his greatness came not by pursuing position, power, or prestige. Rather, with the help of Jesus, he learned that true greatness, the way to move up in life, is to move down. Join us as we discover how John came to redefine greatness in his life - and we can too.
item.itunes:subtitle: G.O.A.T The Greatest of All Time: John
item.itunes:summary: This G.O.A.T. of the Bible was a fisherman, an author, a leader, and one of Jesus' closest disciples. But his greatness came not by pursuing position, power, or prestige. Rather, with the help of Jesus, he learned that true greatness, the way to move up in life, is to move down. Join us as we discover how John came to redefine greatness in his life - and we can too.

item.title: G.O.A.T: David
item.description: This G.O.A.T (Greatest Of All Time) of the Bible was a musician, a shepherd, a giant slayer, and a king. Yet the thing that truly makes him great doesn't come from his success. Sometimes the things that can make a person great happens when we learn to work through failure. Join in as we learn how we can be like David and be great even when we might fail.
item.itunes:subtitle: G.O.A.T: David

Sometimes the things that can make a person great happens when we learn to work through failure. Join in as we learn how we can be like David and be great even when we might fail.

item.title: G.O.A.T: Deborah
item.description: Who would you consider a G.O.A.T. (Greatest Of All Time)? Walt Disney, Mohammad Ali, Mother Teresa, The Beatles, Moses - all legit possibilities. But sometimes a G.O.A.T. might be a person you've never heard of; someone who simply made themselves available and silently changed history. Join in as we open a new series with DEBORAH as the headliner, a Wonder Woman of the Old Testament.

item.description: Did you know that your heart always moves toward what you treasure most, and God wants you to move toward Him? Join us as we discover how we can move closer to God.

item.title: There Is More
item.description: Have you ever wondered if there's more to life than what's on the horizon? Have you ever wondered if there's more to Christianity than just believing in Jesus and going to church? It turns out there IS more. Join us as we discover how life becomes so much more when it's lived for a bigger purpose.

item.title: Choosing Hope - When It Doesn't Make Sense
item.description: We are going to look at how to choose hope when life doesn’t make sense. You don’t want to miss this as our special guest will be Ms. Wheelchair Virginia, Vicki Varner. She will share her story of hope following a tragic accident.

item.title: Choosing Hope - Hear
item.description: A flyer came in the mail that said May is Better Hearing Month. It was an advertisement to get your physical hearing checked. But what about your spiritual hearing? Are you able to hear and discern God's voice? Tune in to sharpen your spiritual hearing as we continue our series, CHOOSING HOPE When I Can't Hear It.

HE IS RISEN & WE HAVE HOPE!

item.title: Encounters - Peter
item.description: If you have ever known the shame and disappointment of failure, this ENCOUNTER is for you! Join in as we look at how an encounter with Jesus can change everything.

item.title: Encounters - Pontius Pilate
item.description: In this podcast we will experience the haunting, face-to-face ENCOUNTER between Jesus and Pontius Pilate, the one who ordered Jesus' execution. Pilate asked Jesus, “What is truth?” In a fallen world, people seem to be willing to bend the truth to advance or protect themselves. As we contrast how each responded, answer for yourself, "What is truth?"

item.title: Encounters - The Skeptic
item.description: Our lives tell stories of encounters-- seemingly chance meetings with people that can, and often do, change us forever. The story of Jesus is a story of encounters. Some are skeptics, while others are outcasts. Some seek him out, while others stumble upon him. But no one remains unchanged.

item.title: Redeemed
item.description: Redemption...what does it mean that we are redeemed? What does it look like? The Bible shows us how God can use some of the most unlikely people to demonstrate His love for us by redeeming our lives. Join us as we take a look at a few different examples where things just don't seem to add up.

item.title: The Right Response
item.description: If someone gave up everything for you, what would you say The Right Response would be? During this message will explore how to cultivate a generous spirit and why the right response to the gift of Jesus is always obedience.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Right Response
item.itunes:summary: If someone gave up everything for you, what would you say The Right Response would be? During this message will explore how to cultivate a generous spirit and why the right response to the gift of Jesus is always obedience.

item.title: Lean In - Clean Body
item.description:
Lean In - Clean Body - Pastor Kris Beckert
The human body is an amazing thing. It can run marathons, store terabytes of data, and undergo hundreds of processes without us being aware. But did you know that what we do with our body also impacts us spiritually? Join us as we wrap up our series "Lean In" as we explore how a "washed body" helps us draw closer to God.

item.title: Lean In - Clear Conscience
item.description: Glen Campbell once said, “There is no pillow as soft as a clear conscience.” Join in as the series, “Lean In” continues, to discover the importance of a clear conscience in drawing closer to God.

item.title: Lean In - Faith
item.description: Leaning into God is our life’s greatest adventure, filled with wonder and fulfillment. The lean began with allowing God to create a sincere heart within us allowing us to live our lives honestly before Him and others. In this message, we will explore the beginning of the dance of faith with our Savior. We will learn the trust to follow as we spin around the dance floor of life, and even begin to explore what it means to lean out.

item.title: Stable Matters - Nobodies Matter
item.description: Have you ever said, “I’m nobody special; I’m not gifted; I’m not important; I have nothing to offer; or God could never use me”? item.title: Stable Matters - Go Tell
item.description:
Stable Matters - Go Tell by Pastor Buddy
It's easy to become so familiar with the Christmas story that we almost turn it into a fable or legend in our minds, missing the beauty of what really matters. Join us as we begin our Christmas series, Stable Matters. You'll have an opportunity to gain a fresh new perspective through the important matters that came out of a simple, stinky stable. We pray the Light of this season will transform your spirit. Remember, Christmas is a great time to invite someone to one of the weekend services.

item.title: Unfrozen
item.description: Unfrozen - Pastor Kris Beckert Have you ever been so afraid of doing something that you did nothing at all? Fear is a powerful force that can serve to protect us but can also freeze us in our tracks, preventing us from living out the full story that God created us to live. But we see in the story of Moses that the power of faith makes it possible to override our apprehension and carry out the mission God has for us. Had Moses allowed fear to freeze him, he never would have won freedom for his people or become the biblical hero we know of today. Whatever fear you're facing, invite a friend to join us as we learn what it takes to be "unfrozen."

item.title: The Best Day Of Your Life - "The Day You Die"
item.description: "And in the end, it's not the years in your life that count; it's the life in your years." - Abraham Lincoln. The Bible says God numbers our days. This week we conclude "The Best Days of Your Life" by looking at our final day on earth. We can be fearful and filled with anxiety; or we can prepare for it and be at peace with God. You're not truly living until you're ready to die! Join in this week as we look at how your last day on earth can be one of the best days of your life.

item.title: Dress Code - "Compassion"
item.description: No Shirt. No Shoes. No Service. Whether we like it or not, there are dress codes in life and if we aren't wearing the proper attire, then we'll have some problems on our hands. But what if we told you that God has a dress code for His followers found in Colossians 3:12? Join us as we begin to unpack the wardrobe what God wants us to put on internally in order to externally convey His love accurately to the world around us.

Invite a friend - we can all try and answer the question "Where are you?"

item.title: The Second Mile
item.description: Summertime is the perfect time to plan a road trip. Some of our best memories are built on a killer road trip. What if you were told to take a road trip but weren’t allowed to pack any clothes, or take any money, or even take any food? What if all you could do was get in a car with some of your friends and drive to a town and then try to survive for awhile? Something crazy would be bound to happen and there would be guaranteed memories, but no one would ever do that would they? What if that is exactly what Jesus told us to do, how in the world would we survive it, and why would he ask such a thing? Come and find out the mystery of the greatest road trip ever, and bring a friend, you will need them for sure.

item.description: Have you ever felt behind in the count financially, relationally, or emotionally? What do you do when you feel like your life is trailing in the bottom of the ninth with two strikes and two outs? In this message, we discover how to win when it seems game over.

item.title: A Message About Suicide
item.description:
The CDC reports that suicides are up over the last 2 decades. This troubling statistic needs to be reversed. With two high profile celebrities taking their own life recently, the National Suicide Hotline reported that calls for help are up 25%. That's good news.
Join in on "A Message About Suicide" to discover how to find true hope, purpose and meaning in life.

item.title: Drawing Happiness
item.description: How do you draw a happy life? Happiness is what usually dictates what job we take, who we spend time with, what we buy, what school we attend, and where we go. But what do you do when the things you expect to make you happy either don't happen as you'd expect or don’t seem to get you there? Does God even want you to be happy? Join us this as we look at what Jesus has to say about the surprising way to draw lasting happiness.

item.title: Fathers Day Weekend
item.description: Sonora Dodd from Spokane, Washington first suggested a "Father's Day" in 1909. Though her father was a Civil War Veteran, she believed her widowed father with six children deserved to be honored as a father. Father's Day is now celebrated around the world. This weekend we will encourage and honor fathers.

item.description: It's not wise to believe everything we see or hear as true. Airbrushed bodies on magazines; sensational stories; biased news outlets; even religious folklore & false prophets are alive & well. All have power to misguide hearts and minds. We are concluding the series, "DON'T BE FOOLED" with,"Who Is The Fool?" Invite friends and family to discover what the Bible says & how we can choose NOT to join the club!

item.title: Don't Be Fooled - Church Still Matters
item.description: Did you know that more than 80 percent of Americans are finding more fulfilling things to do on weekends then attending church? But, don’t be fooled - going to church regularly is very important to our spiritual lives. Join us as we discover why Church attendance is important to our spiritual development. This would be a good opportunity to invite someone that hasn’t been to church in a while.

item.title: Don't Be Fooled - Our Choices Affect Generations
item.description: We are a distracted people. And yes, we actually miss the now because we’re too busy focusing on what’s way out the in the future. But don’t be fooled and get too caught up in the momentary feeling of the present that you neglect to realize the impact right now has on tomorrow. Our present choices carry weight and we’re not just talking about for our own future or even our kids futures. The effects of a single choice can transform generations, for better or worse. Join us as we battle plan to make sure we are impacting generations for the better, one choice at a time.

In this message, we continue our series “Don’t Be Fooled" as we discover why "God Won’t Wink at our Sin".

item.description: Jesus says, “Eat Me!” SAY WHAT?? Join us as we look at one of the most challenging and impossible “Say What” statements spoken by Jesus.
item.itunes:subtitle: Say What - Eat Me
item.itunes:summary: Jesus says, “Eat Me!” SAY WHAT?? Join us as we look at one of the most challenging and impossible “Say What” statements spoken by Jesus.

item.title: Say What - Don't Judge
item.description: Jesus invites people to live in a way that leads to joy and freedom. Yet, taken at face value, His words seem impossible to live, like “love your enemies” and “don’t be anxious”. This week we will look at probably one of His most consistently broken and neglected commands yet, “Don’t judge...”. SAY WHAT?

item.title: Say What - Don't Be Anxious
item.description: Jesus, in His own words, invites us to live by what is humanly impossible. “Say What?” It’s true, like, love your enemies; and this week, another ridiculous challenge, “Do not be anxious.” Join in as we face anxiety and fear head on!

item.title: Say What - Love Your Enemy
item.description: This week we begin a new series called “Say What!” Just about the time we think we have Jesus figured out, He throws us for a loop with a statement that’s not only hard to understand, but even harder to swallow. This week we will look at “Love your enemies” - Say What? Seriously? Join us as we kick-off this challenging new series.

item.title: God Talk
item.description: There is nothing worse than an awkward silence. You know, that moment when you are just sitting there and you have no idea what to say, and even if you could come up with something, the words would probably get all jumbled up. Most of the time we don’t think whoever we are talking to even cares about what we are saying. When it’s a parent, oh boy, we are sure they are judging us. What about court? Dry mouth and sweaty palms, and nothing coming out that makes any sense. I have heard all these comparisons when asking people about how they talk to God. This week we are going to discover the four P’s of Prayer and enjoy some practical “God Talk”.

item.title: Work As Worship
item.description: In a National Survey of 180,000 American workers, 80 percent indicated a dislike for their jobs; yet we will spend about 90,000 hours of our life at work. Join us as we discover how to actually serve God and love our work at the same time.

item.title: Fixer Upper: Family
item.description: This week we conclude our series, FIXER-UPPER: "Family". In the smash HGTV show, Chip & Joanna Gaines are pros at redeeming dilapidated houses and restoring beauty. But a house is not a home until a family moves in. Join in as we explore the grander purpose of why Chip and Joanna are so great at what they do. The Bible has a lot to say about the importance of family and faith.

item.title: Fixer Upper: Failure
item.description: Everybody fails. The question is not ‘how bad the failure is’… the question is “how good your response to the failure is’… Join us as we continue our series “Fixer Upper” as we discover how to recover from failure.

item.title: Fixer Upper: Finances
item.description: Money and debt is a leading cause of stress and a common cause for divorce in America today. If we don’t have it, we’re thinking about how we can get it. And when we do have it, we’re consumed by how to keep it. Join us as we continue our series, Fixer Upper, as we discover a path to fixing our finances.

item.title: The Follow Through
item.description: It's a new year which means new resolutions. But how many of us find ourselves making the same resolutions this year as we did last year? Or, maybe we have big ambitions in our heart for the new year, but have no idea how to achieve them. Join us as we discover how to make sure this year is not just the year of great ideas and the best of intentions, but the year of the follow through.

item.description: As the end of the year quickly approaches, your joyful and generous involvement through year-end giving is vital to the ministry of SFCC. Any contributions to our year-end giving will go to Unleash Hope: Thanksgiving Offering to provide for the needs of others in our church, community, nation and world. The benefits of income tax deductions, capital gains savings and other financial benefits are significant advantages that provide an incentive to make a gift at the year-end.

item.title: Simple Christmas
item.description: It's the most wonderful time of the year! The beautiful lights, the excitement in the air and the anticipation of all that Christmas brings is in full swing. This week we begin a new series, "SIMPLE CHRISTMAS". Life can get busy and complicated, especially at this time of year. So take some time to stop and reflect on the simple beauty of the reason for the season. Invite your friends and family to worship with you and experience the joy that only the simple meaning of Christmas can bring.

item.title: Thanks Giving
item.description: GIVING THANKS. To some, this time of year is about Black Friday; for others, its football, turkey and pumpkin pie! There's so much for which to be thankful. This week, we will take intentional time to thank God for who He is and all He's given us. We can show our thanks through singing, prayer, testimonies and generosity. Remember to invite someone to a weekend service to enjoy the presence of God through giving thanks. May your Thanksgiving season be filled with the blessings of food, family and friends.

item.title: The New Normal: Uncertainty
item.description: This week we conclude the series on the New Normal. In light of everything that has happened recently it is fitting that this week we talk about uncertainty. The New Normal is that no one knows what is going to happen next. People are reacting in all kinds of ways trying to make sense of the chaos. We want to protect ourselves and our neighbors, but we don’t know how, because we don’t know what is coming. We are going to explore whether the Bible can really help guide us in these uncertain times.

We are going to explore whether the Bible can really help guide us in these uncertain times.

item.title: The New Normal: Protesting Injustice
item.description: If we watch the evening news or peruse social media , it doesn't take long to see and hear angry voices protesting almost everything. Yet behind the scenes, there are millions of people, with quieter voices living out lives of personal freedom and service to others. What makes the difference between the two? This week we explore how the Bible says to "Protest Injustice" as we continue our series, "THE NEW NORMAL".

item.title: The New Normal: Marriage
item.description: We live in a "post-truth" culture. "Post-truth" means people use opinion, feelings and popularity as their standard for making life decisions. In this series, "The New Normal," we're looking at some timeless truths of the Bible that our culture has rewritten for personal benefit. This week we will be exploring "Marriage."

item.title: The New Normal: Authority
item.description: We live in a world that hates authority, hates to follow the rules, hates being told what to do and hates to submit. Join us as we continue our series, “The New Normal”, where we'll discover the importance of living under authority.

item.description: We are starting a new series called "The New Normal." Over the next few weeks we are going to look at some New Normals in our culture today and what the Bible says about these changes. We will kick the series by looking at the New Normal in how we communicate.

item.title: HIdden Things
item.description: Did you know that God has some hidden things He wants to share with you about your life and the circumstances you may be facing? Join us as we discover the key to uncovering those hidden things.

item.title: Lifeguards - Impacting Community
item.description:
More than ever, our world needs people to join together in healthy, life-giving ways to impact our communities. This series, LIFEGUARDS, has emphasized life "guards", that when put in place, produce healthy people, healthy families, and healthy churches.
Join us as we explore how we can impact our communities by being a shining light of hope in our world. SFCC stands together by choosing God's love. #WeChooseLove

item.title: Lifeguards - We Are Church
item.description: One glance at the news and you know that something is going terribly wrong in society today. Fear and anger are dragging people under, and we need lifeguards now more than ever. The lifeguard series continues this weekend when we talk about the next step from a healthy person, and a healthy family. What if God created natural lifeguards for our world? What would they look like? Come and find out what God’s lifeguards look like.

item.title: Lifeguards - My Family
item.description: Family is something we all have in common, designed by God to give safety and security to its members. Yet family relationships can also be tough. Join us as we continue our series “Lifeguards” and look at some important ways to guard the heart of our family.

item.title: Lifeguards - Guarding My Heart
item.description: A new series, "LIFEGUARDS" kicks off. Just like a beach lifeguard that looks out for, warns and protects swimmers so they can enjoy the ocean, we will look for the life "guards" that can keep us from drowning spiritually. The Bible says to guard our heart. Why? Because it determines the course of our life. Invite a friend to join you to worship and learn more about how to live a joyful, peace-filled life.

item.title: Stay Calm "In Suffering"
item.description: Suffering is never easy. It's painful. It's scary. And it can challenge our faith to the core. But, as we close out our Stay Calm Series, we're going to discover that by changing the way we look at suffering, we will be able to see a God that is fighting for us in the midst of it, and in more ways than we could possibly imagine.

item.title: Missionaries - Rolf & Debbie Kleinfeld
item.description:
At SFCC, we all know we exist to know Jesus and share real hope with anyone, everywhere. And we partner with people around the world who share this belief.
This week we will meet a very special couple, Rolf and Debbie Kleinfeld. They live in Cambodia teaching and guiding local leaders as they share the Real Hope with a beautiful, yet struggling, population in Southeast Asia.

item.title: Stay Calm "When I Am Busy"
item.description: Kid's soccer games, dance lessons, and sports practices, work responsibilities and work-related meetings, church, school events, and work-around-the-house stuff can leave you frazzled. Join us as we learn "how to stay calm when we are busy."

item.title: Stay Calm "In Your Anger"
item.description: In Proverbs it says, “A fool is quick-tempered, but a wise person stays calm when insulted.” How can we go from being angry when insulted, to calm? This week we look at the God-design for our anger. Our problem is that we've witnessed so many bad examples of anger, that we've lost God's original intention for it. Join in as we learn how to "STAY CALM In Your Anger."
item.itunes:subtitle: Stay Calm "In Your Anger"

Join in as we learn how to "STAY CALM In Your Anger."

item.title: Stay Calm: "Financial Pressure"
item.description: No money...for movies, dinners out or anything but essentials like food, gas and toilet paper. Not exactly the dream life, is it? This 4th of July, though millions will celebrate our freedom as Americans, many are enslaved to financial debt. We will learn how to STAY CALM personally and spiritually by breaking free from financial debt.

item.title: Stay Calm "During Times of Uncertainty"
item.description: The world around us is full of uncertainty. We are uncertain about what each moment of each day can bring. When bad things happen we are uncertain if good will come again. We could be making a life changing decision uncertain of all of the outcomes from that decision. Wars and storms all around us - will there ever be peace again? Join us as we learn to find peace when we "Stay Calm during time of Uncertainty."

item.description: This week we are going to look at a common fear among men, how it cripples our potential for spiritual and relational growth and how to stay calm when faced with this fear. Join us as we celebrate dads and continue our series "Stay Calm."

item.itunes:summary: This week we are going to look at a common fear among men, how it cripples our potential for spiritual and relational growth and how to stay calm when faced with this fear. Join us as we celebrate dads and continue our series "Stay Calm."

item.title: Stay Calm "Diffusing The Power of Anxiety and Fear"
item.description: This past weekend we began a new series - "STAY CALM." The demands of life can easily rob us of God's blessings. Dangers in our world, busy schedules, workplace demands, and relationship challenges all pose obstacles to our personal peace and tranquility. Join us as we explore how God will fight for us to overcome ANXIETY & FEAR. The demands and challenges of life will not change, but we can learn to STAY CALM anyway.
item.itunes:subtitle: Stay Calm "Diffusing The Power of Anxiety and Fear"

item.title: The Unfathomable God
item.description: Do you ever feel like your life is just too ordinary to ever make a difference? That maybe we just do not have what it takes to overcome this formidable and incomprehensible world? Join us as we discover how our unfathomable God can turn the ordinary into extraordinary!

item.title: Standing In The Gap
item.description: Monday is Memorial Day. A day of remembering. With our busy lives we sometimes forget what Memorial Day is all about. Join us as we remember those who gave their lives standing in the gap fighting an enemy to protect our freedom. We will also learn how we too can stand in the gap to fight an enemy that is trying to steal our freedom in Christ.

item.title: Wrong Turn Straight to God
item.description: God has expanded Salem Fields Community Church's territory into Smithfield, VA and new relationships have formed. Anthony Robinette was a drug dealer who took a wrong turn, which ended up to be a right turn, into a church parking lot. That day, Anthony went from being part of the darkness to becoming a light for Christ. He now ministers to the broken in Smithfield. Join in to hear what God is up to through Anthony and SFCC.

item.title: The Power of A Mother's Faith
item.description: "THE POWER OF A MOTHER'S FAITH" There is no greater career or more important task than shaping the lives of the next generation. Mothers do just that. It is a most prestigious position, yet our culture too often gives it a back seat of importance. We celebrate Moms and say "thank-you" for infusing life and love into our world.

item.title: No Matter What
item.description: Sometimes life deals you a bad hand. What do you do then? Do you can get angry with God or do you give up on God altogether. Or do you conclude that God doesn't know what he's doing or that He doesn’t care. Or that the universe has spun out of God's control? Join us as we discover how to trust God “No Matter What” is happening in your life from the tiny book of Habakkuk.
